findings.title: Timestamp Dependence
findings.description: The contract's functionality relies on timestamp values (startClaimTimestamp and finishTimestamp) which can be manipulated by the owner, potentially affecting token distribution and withdrawal.

findings.title: Gas Limit and Loops
findings.description: Potential issue with gas limit and loops in smart contract code

findings.title: DoS with (Unexpected) Throw
findings.description: This finding indicates a potential Denial of Service vulnerability due to an unexpected throw statement in the contract, which can cause the contract to be stuck in an infinite loop and lead to a denial-of-service attack.

findings.title: DoS with Block Gas Limit
findings.description: This finding indicates a potential Denial of Service (DoS) vulnerability due to block gas limit issues.

findings.title: Unchecked external call
findings.description: The contract contains an unchecked external call which can lead to reentrancy attacks or other unintended behavior.

findings.title: Implicit visibility level
findings.description: Functions or variables without an explicit visibility specifier have an implicit visibility level.

findings.title: Token Supply manipulation
findings.description: Potential unauthorized modification of token supply

findings.title: User Balances manipulation
findings.description: Potential vulnerability allowing unauthorized modification of user balances.

findings.title: Operation Trails & Event Generation
findings.description: This finding relates to potential security vulnerabilities in the generation of operation trails and events within smart contracts.

findings.title: setStartClaimTimestamp can be used by owners to change the startClaimTimestamp value
findings.description: Owners can modify the startClaimTimestamp value, potentially affecting customers who already purchased tokens and may not receive them as expected.

findings.title: setFinishTimestamp can be used by owners to change the finishTimestamp value
findings.description: This allows to transfer unsold tokens at any time. As a result, customers who already purchased tokens may not receive them when they expect to.

findings.title: Usage of the ReentrancyGuard is redundant
findings.description: The usage of the ReentrancyGuard is unnecessary and can be removed.
